neighbourhoods on the island of Montreal.</figcaption></figure>\n\n<p id=\"mwAqg\">The city is composed of 19 large <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Boroughs_of_Montreal\" title=\"Boroughs of Montreal\" id=\"mwAqk\">boroughs</a>, subdivided into neighbourhoods.<sup about=\"#mwt672\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-Bits_110-0\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{\"name\":\"Bits\"},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-Bits-110\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-Bits-110\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 110;\" id=\"mwAqo\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwAqs\">[110]</span></a></sup>\nThe boroughs are:\n<a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Côte-des-Neiges–Notre-Dame-de-Grâce\" title=\"Côte-des-Neiges–Notre-Dame-de-Grâce\" id=\"mwAqw\">Côte-des-Neiges–Notre-Dame-de-Grace</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Le_Plateau-Mont-Royal\" title=\"Le Plateau-Mont-Royal\" id=\"mwAq0\">The Plateau Mount Royal</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Outremont_(borough)\" title=\"Outremont (borough)\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAq4\">Outremont</a> and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Ville-Marie_(Montreal)\" title=\"Ville-Marie (Montreal)\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAq8\">Ville Marie</a> in the centre; <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Mercier–Hochelaga-Maisonneuve\" title=\"Mercier–Hochelaga-Maisonneuve\" id=\"mwArA\">Mercier–Hochelaga-Maisonneuve</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Rosemont–La_Petite-Patrie\" title=\"Rosemont–La Petite-Patrie\" id=\"mwArE\">Rosemont–La Petite-Patrie</a> and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Villeray–Saint-Michel–Parc-Extension\" title=\"Villeray–Saint-Michel–Parc-Extension\" id=\"mwArI\">Villeray–Saint-Michel–Parc-Extension</a> in the east; <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Anjou_(borough)\" title=\"Anjou (borough)\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwArM\">Anjou</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montréal-Nord\" title=\"Montréal-Nord\" id=\"mwArQ\">Montréal-Nord</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Rivière-des-Prairies–Pointe-aux-Trembles\" title=\"Rivière-des-Prairies–Pointe-aux-Trembles\" id=\"mwArU\">Rivière-des-Prairies–Pointe-aux-Trembles</a> and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Saint-Leonard,_Quebec\" title=\"Saint-Leonard, Quebec\" id=\"mwArY\">Saint-Leonard</a> in the northeast; <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Ahuntsic-Cartierville\" title=\"Ahuntsic-Cartierville\" id=\"mwArc\">Ahuntsic-Cartierville</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./L'Île-Bizard–Sainte-Geneviève\" title=\"L'Île-Bizard–Sainte-Geneviève\" id=\"mwArg\">L'Île-Bizard–Sainte-Geneviève</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Pierrefonds-Roxboro\" title=\"Pierrefonds-Roxboro\" id=\"mwArk\">Pierrefonds-Roxboro</a> and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Saint-Laurent_(borough)\" title=\"Saint-Laurent (borough)\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAro\">Saint-Laurent</a> in the northwest; and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Lachine_(borough)\" title=\"Lachine (borough)\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwArs\">Lachine</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./LaSalle_(borough)\" title=\"LaSalle (borough)\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwArw\">LaSalle</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Le_Sud-Ouest\" title=\"Le Sud-Ouest\" id=\"mwAr0\">The South West</a> and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Verdun_(borough)\" title=\"Verdun (borough)\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAr4\">Verdun</a> in the south.<link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:All_articles_with_unsourced_statements\" about=\"#mwt673\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"citation needed\",\"href\":\"./Template:Citation_needed\"},\"params\":{\"date\":{\"wt\":\"May 2022\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwAr8\"/><link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:Articles_with_unsourced_statements_from_May_2022\" about=\"#mwt673\"/><sup class=\"noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact\" style=\"white-space:nowrap;\" about=\"#mwt673\" id=\"mwAsA\"><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">[</span><i><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Wikipedia:Citation_needed\" title=\"Wikipedia:Citation needed\"><span title=\"This claim needs references to reliable sources. (May 2022)\">citation needed</span></a></i><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">]</span></sup></p>\n\n<p id=\"mwAsE\">Many of these boroughs were independent cities that were forced to merge with Montreal in January 2002 following the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./2002-2006_municipal_reorganization_of_Montreal\" title=\"2002-2006 municipal reorganization of Montreal\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAsI\">2002 municipal reorganization of Montreal</a>.</p>\n\n<figure class=\"mw-default-size mw-halign-left\" typeof=\"mw:File/Thumb\" id=\"mwAsM\"><a href=\"./File:Montreal_August_2017_05.jpg\" class=\"mw-file-description\" id=\"mwAsQ\"><img resource=\"./File:Montreal_August_2017_05.jpg\" src=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d0/Montreal_August_2017_05.jpg/220px-Montreal_August_2017_05.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" data-file-width=\"5852\" data-file-height=\"3292\" data-file-type=\"bitmap\" height=\"124\" width=\"220\" srcset=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d0/Montreal_August_2017_05.jpg/330px-Montreal_August_2017_05.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d0/Montreal_August_2017_05.jpg/440px-Montreal_August_2017_05.jpg 2x\" class=\"mw-file-element\" id=\"mwAsU\"/></a><figcaption id=\"mwAsY\">A view of <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Downtown_Montreal\" title=\"Downtown Montreal\" id=\"mwAsc\">Downtown Montreal</a> from <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Mont_Royal\" title=\"Mont Royal\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAsg\">Mont Royal</a>. Many neighbourhoods, including downtown, are in the borough of <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Ville-Marie,_Montreal\" title=\"Ville-Marie, Montreal\" id=\"mwAsk\">Ville-Marie</a>.</figcaption></figure>\n\n<p id=\"mwAso\">The borough with the most neighbourhoods is Ville Marie, which includes downtown, the historical district of Old Montreal, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Chinatown_(Montreal)\" title=\"Chinatown (Montreal)\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAss\">Chinatown</a>, the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Gay_Village,_Montreal\" title=\"Gay Village, Montreal\" id=\"mwAsw\">Gay Village</a>, the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Quartier_Latin,_Montreal\" title=\"Quartier Latin, Montreal\" id=\"mwAs0\">Latin Quarter</a>, the gentrified <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Quartier_international_de_Montréal\" title=\"Quartier international de Montréal\" id=\"mwAs4\">Quartier international</a> and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Cité_Multimédia\" title=\"Cité Multimédia\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAs8\">Cité Multimédia</a> as well as the Quartier des Spectacles which is under development. Other neighbourhoods of interest in the borough include the affluent Golden Square Mile neighbourhood at the foot of Mount Royal and the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Shaughnessy_Village\" title=\"Shaughnessy Village\" id=\"mwAtA\">Shaughnessy Village</a>/<a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Quartier_Concordia\" title=\"Quartier Concordia\" id=\"mwAtE\">Concordia U</a> area home to thousands of students at <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Concordia_University_(Montreal)\" title=\"Concordia University (Montreal)\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAtI\">Concordia University</a>. The borough also comprises most of <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Mount_Royal_Park\" title=\"Mount Royal Park\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAtM\">Mount Royal Park</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Saint_Helen's_Island\" title=\"Saint Helen's Island\" id=\"mwAtQ\">Saint Helen's Island</a>, and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Île_Notre-Dame\" title=\"Île Notre-Dame\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAtU\">Notre-Dame Island</a>.<link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:All_articles_with_unsourced_statements\" about=\"#mwt674\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"citation needed\",\"href\":\"./Template:Citation_needed\"},\"params\":{\"date\":{\"wt\":\"May 2022\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwAtY\"/><link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:Articles_with_unsourced_statements_from_May_2022\" about=\"#mwt674\"/><sup class=\"noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact\" style=\"white-space:nowrap;\" about=\"#mwt674\" id=\"mwAtc\"><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">[</span><i><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Wikipedia:Citation_needed\" title=\"Wikipedia:Citation needed\"><span title=\"This claim needs references to reliable sources. (May 2022)\">citation needed</span></a></i><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">]</span></sup></p>\n\n<p id=\"mwAtg\">The <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Plateau\" title=\"Plateau\" id=\"mwAtk\">Plateau</a> Mount Royal borough was a working class francophone area. The largest neighbourhood is <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./The_Plateau\" title=\"The Plateau\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAto\">the Plateau</a> (not to be confused with the whole borough), which is undergoing considerable gentrification,<sup about=\"#mwt681\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-111\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-111\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-111\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 111;\" id=\"mwAts\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwAtw\">[111]</span></a></sup> and a 2001 study deemed it as Canada's most creative neighbourhood because artists comprise 8% of its labour force.<sup about=\"#mwt685\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-Hill_112-0\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{\"name\":\"Hill\"},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-Hill-112\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-Hill-112\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 112;\" id=\"mwAt0\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwAt4\">[112]</span></a></sup> The neighbourhood of <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Mile_End,_Montreal\" title=\"Mile End, Montreal\" id=\"mwAt8\">Mile End</a> in the northwestern part of the borough has been a very multicultural area of the city, and features two of Montreal's well-known <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal-style_bagel\" title=\"Montreal-style bagel\" id=\"mwAuA\">bagel establishments</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./St-Viateur_Bagel\" title=\"St-Viateur Bagel\" id=\"mwAuE\">St-Viateur Bagel</a> and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Fairmount_Bagel\" title=\"Fairmount Bagel\" id=\"mwAuI\">Fairmount Bagel</a>. The <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./McGill_Ghetto\" title=\"McGill Ghetto\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAuM\">McGill Ghetto</a> is in the extreme southwestern portion of the borough, its name being derived from the fact that it is home to thousands of <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./McGill_University\" title=\"McGill University\" id=\"mwAuQ\">McGill University</a> students and faculty members.<link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:All_articles_with_unsourced_statements\" about=\"#mwt677\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"citation needed\",\"href\":\"./Template:Citation_needed\"},\"params\":{\"date\":{\"wt\":\"May 2022\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwAuU\"/><link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:Articles_with_unsourced_statements_from_May_2022\" about=\"#mwt677\"/><sup class=\"noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact\" style=\"white-space:nowrap;\" about=\"#mwt677\" id=\"mwAuY\"><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">[</span><i><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Wikipedia:Citation_needed\" title=\"Wikipedia:Citation needed\"><span title=\"This claim needs references to reliable sources. (May 2022)\">citation needed</span></a></i><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">]</span></sup></p>\n\n<p id=\"mwAuc\">The South West borough was home to much of the city's industry during the late 19th and early-to-mid 20th century. The borough included <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Goose_Village,_Montreal\" title=\"Goose Village, Montreal\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAug\">Goose Village</a> and was historically home to the traditionally working-class <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Irish_Quebecer\" title=\"Irish Quebecer\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAuk\">Irish</a> neighbourhoods of Griffintown and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Pointe-Saint-Charles\" title=\"Pointe-Saint-Charles\" id=\"mwAuo\">Point Saint Charles</a> as well as the low-income neighbourhoods of <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Saint-Henri\" title=\"Saint-Henri\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAus\">Saint Henri</a> and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Little_Burgundy\" title=\"Little Burgundy\" id=\"mwAuw\">Little Burgundy</a>.<link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:All_articles_with_unsourced_statements\" about=\"#mwt686\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"citation needed\",\"href\":\"./Template:Citation_needed\"},\"params\":{\"date\":{\"wt\":\"May 2022\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwAu0\"/><link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:Articles_with_unsourced_statements_from_May_2022\" about=\"#mwt686\"/><sup class=\"noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact\" style=\"white-space:nowrap;\" about=\"#mwt686\" id=\"mwAu4\"><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">[</span><i><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Wikipedia:Citation_needed\" title=\"Wikipedia:Citation needed\"><span title=\"This claim needs references to reliable sources. (May 2022)\">citation needed</span></a></i><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">]</span></sup></p>\n\n<p id=\"mwAu8\">Other notable neighbourhoods include the multicultural areas of <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Notre-Dame-de-Grâce\" title=\"Notre-Dame-de-Grâce\" id=\"mwAvA\">Notre-Dame-de-Grâce</a> and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Côte-des-Neiges\" title=\"Côte-des-Neiges\" id=\"mwAvE\">Côte-des-Neiges</a> in the Côte-des-Neiges–Notre-Dame-de-Grace borough, and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Little_Italy,_Montreal\" title=\"Little Italy, Montreal\" id=\"mwAvI\">Little Italy</a> in the borough of Rosemont–La Petite-Patrie and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Hochelaga-Maisonneuve\" title=\"Hochelaga-Maisonneuve\" id=\"mwAvM\">Hochelaga-Maisonneuve</a>, home of the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Olympic_Stadium,_Montreal\" title=\"Olympic Stadium, Montreal\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAvQ\">Olympic Stadium</a> in the borough of Mercier–Hochelaga-Maisonneuve.<link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:All_articles_with_unsourced_statements\" about=\"#mwt687\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"citation needed\",\"href\":\"./Template:Citation_needed\"},\"params\":{\"date\":{\"wt\":\"May 2022\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwAvU\"/><link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:Articles_with_unsourced_statements_from_May_2022\" about=\"#mwt687\"/><sup class=\"noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact\" style=\"white-space:nowrap;\" about=\"#mwt687\" id=\"mwAvY\"><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">[</span><i><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Wikipedia:Citation_needed\" title=\"Wikipedia:Citation needed\"><span title=\"This claim needs references to reliable sources. (May 2022)\">citation needed</span></a></i><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">]</span></sup></p>\n\n<section data-mw-section-id=\"11\" id=\"mwAvc\"><h3 id=\"Old_Montreal\">Old Montreal</h3>\n<link id=\"mwAv8\"><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Place_Jacques-Cartier\" title=\"Place Jacques-Cartier\" id=\"mwAwA\">Place Jacques-Cartier</a> is a major <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Public_square\" title=\"Public square\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAwE\">public square</a> and attraction in <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Old_Montreal\" title=\"Old Montreal\" id=\"mwAwI\">Old Montreal</a>.</figcaption></figure>\n\n<p id=\"mwAwM\">Old Montreal is a historic area southeast of downtown containing many attractions such as the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Old_Port_of_Montreal\" title=\"Old Port of Montreal\" id=\"mwAwQ\">Old Port of Montreal</a>, Place Jacques-Cartier, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal_City_Hall\" title=\"Montreal City Hall\" id=\"mwAwU\">Montreal City Hall</a>, the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Bonsecours_Market\" title=\"Bonsecours Market\" id=\"mwAwY\">Bonsecours Market</a>, Place d'Armes, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Pointe-à-Callière_Museum\" title=\"Pointe-à-Callière Museum\" id=\"mwAwc\">Pointe-à-Callière Museum</a>, the Notre-Dame de Montréal Basilica, and the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal_Science_Centre\" title=\"Montreal Science Centre\" id=\"mwAwg\">Montreal Science Centre</a>.<link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:All_articles_with_unsourced_statements\" about=\"#mwt694\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"Citation needed\",\"href\":\"./Template:Citation_needed\"},\"params\":{\"date\":{\"wt\":\"May 2022\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwAwk\"/><link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:Articles_with_unsourced_statements_from_May_2022\" about=\"#mwt694\"/><sup class=\"noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact\" style=\"white-space:nowrap;\" about=\"#mwt694\" id=\"mwAwo\"><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">[</span><i><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Wikipedia:Citation_needed\" title=\"Wikipedia:Citation needed\"><span title=\"This claim needs references to reliable sources. (May 2022)\">citation needed</span></a></i><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">]</span></sup></p>\n\n<p id=\"mwAws\">Architecture and cobbled streets in Old Montreal have been maintained or restored. Old Montreal is accessible from the downtown core via the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Underground_city,_Montreal\" title=\"Underground city, Montreal\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAww\">underground city</a> and is served by several <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Société_de_transport_de_Montréal\" title=\"Société de transport de Montréal\" id=\"mwAw0\">STM</a> bus routes and Metro stations, ferries to the South Shore and a network of bicycle paths.<link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:All_articles_with_unsourced_statements\" about=\"#mwt695\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"citation needed\",\"href\":\"./Template:Citation_needed\"},\"params\":{\"date\":{\"wt\":\"May 2022\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwAw4\"/><link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:Articles_with_unsourced_statements_from_May_2022\" about=\"#mwt695\"/><sup class=\"noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact\" style=\"white-space:nowrap;\" about=\"#mwt695\" id=\"mwAw8\"><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">[</span><i><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Wikipedia:Citation_needed\" title=\"Wikipedia:Citation needed\"><span title=\"This claim needs references to reliable sources. (May 2022)\">citation needed</span></a></i><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">]</span></sup></p>\n\n<p id=\"mwAxA\">The riverside area adjacent to Old Montreal is known as the Old Port. The Old Port was the site of the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Port_of_Montreal\" title=\"Port of Montreal\" id=\"mwAxE\">Port of Montreal</a>, but its shipping operations have been moved to a larger site downstream, leaving the former location as a recreational and historical area maintained by <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Parks_Canada\" title=\"Parks Canada\" id=\"mwAxI\">Parks Canada</a>. The new Port of Montreal is Canada's largest container port and the largest inland port on Earth.<sup about=\"#mwt700\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-113\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-113\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-113\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 113;\" id=\"mwAxM\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwAxQ\">[113]</span></a></sup></p>\n\n</section><section data-mw-section-id=\"12\" id=\"mwAxU\"><h3 id=\"Mount_Royal\">Mount Royal</h3>\n<link rel=\"mw-deduplicated-inline-style\" href=\"mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096\" about=\"#mwt701\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/templatestyles mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"Main\",\"href\":\"./Template:Main\"},\"params\":{\"1\":{\"wt\":\"Mount Royal\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwAxY\"/><div role=\"note\" class=\"hatnote navigation-not-searchable\" about=\"#mwt701\" id=\"mwAxc\">Main article: <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Mount_Royal\" title=\"Mount Royal\">Mount Royal</a></div>\n\n<p id=\"mwAxg\">The mountain is the site of Mount Royal Park, one of Montreal's largest <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Open_space_reserve\" title=\"Open space reserve\" id=\"mwAxk\">greenspaces</a>. The park, most of which is wooded, was designed by <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Frederick_Law_Olmsted\" title=\"Frederick Law Olmsted\" id=\"mwAxo\">Frederick Law Olmsted</a>, who also designed New York's <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Central_Park\" title=\"Central Park\" id=\"mwAxs\">Central Park</a>, and was inaugurated in 1876.<sup about=\"#mwt708\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-LesAmisDeLaMontagne_114-0\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{\"name\":\"LesAmisDeLaMontagne\"},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-LesAmisDeLaMontagne-114\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-LesAmisDeLaMontagne-114\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 114;\" id=\"mwAxw\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwAx0\">[114]</span></a></sup></p>\n\n<figure class=\"mw-default-size mw-halign-left\" typeof=\"mw:File/Thumb\" id=\"mwAx4\"><a href=\"./File:Mtroyal.jpg\" class=\"mw-file-description\" id=\"mwAx8\"><img resource=\"./File:Mtroyal.jpg\" src=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Mtroyal.jpg/220px-Mtroyal.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" data-file-width=\"640\" data-file-height=\"270\" data-file-type=\"bitmap\" height=\"93\" width=\"220\" srcset=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Mtroyal.jpg/330px-Mtroyal.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Mtroyal.jpg/440px-Mtroyal.jpg 2x\" class=\"mw-file-element\" id=\"mwAyA\"/></a><figcaption id=\"mwAyE\">View of <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Mont-Royal\" title=\"Mont-Royal\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAyI\">Mont-Royal</a>'s eastern slope from the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./George-Étienne_Cartier_Monument\" title=\"George-Étienne Cartier Monument\" id=\"mwAyM\">George-Étienne Cartier Monument</a>. The park is one of Montreal's largest <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Open_space_reserve\" title=\"Open space reserve\" id=\"mwAyQ\">open space reserves</a>.</figcaption></figure>\n\n<p id=\"mwAyU\">The park contains two <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Belvedere_(structure)\" title=\"Belvedere (structure)\" id=\"mwAyY\">belvederes</a>, the more prominent of which is the Kondiaronk Belvedere, a semicircular plaza with a <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Chalet\" title=\"Chalet\" id=\"mwAyc\">chalet</a> overlooking Downtown Montreal. Other features of the park are Beaver Lake, a small man-made lake, a short <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Skiing\" title=\"Skiing\" id=\"mwAyg\">ski</a> <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Ski_slope\" title=\"Ski slope\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAyk\">slope</a>, a <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Sculpture_garden\" title=\"Sculpture garden\" id=\"mwAyo\">sculpture garden</a>, Smith House, an <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Interpretive_centre\" title=\"Interpretive centre\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwAys\">interpretive centre</a>, and a well-known <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./George-Étienne_Cartier_Monument\" title=\"George-Étienne Cartier Monument\" id=\"mwAyw\">monument to Sir George-Étienne Cartier</a>. The park hosts athletic, tourist and cultural activities.</p>\n\n<p id=\"mwAy0\">The mountain is home to two major cemeteries, Notre-Dame-des-Neiges (founded in 1854) and Mount Royal (1852). <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Mount_Royal_Cemetery\" title=\"Mount Royal Cemetery\" id=\"mwAy4\">Mount Royal Cemetery</a> is a <span about=\"#mwt711\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"convert\",\"href\":\"./Template:Convert\"},\"params\":{\"1\":{\"wt\":\"165\"},\"2\":{\"wt\":\"acre\"},\"3\":{\"wt\":\"ha\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwAy8\">165 acres (67</span><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\" about=\"#mwt711\"> </span><span about=\"#mwt711\">ha)</span> terraced cemetery on the north slope of Mount Royal in the borough of Outremont. <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Notre_Dame_des_Neiges_Cemetery\" title=\"Notre Dame des Neiges Cemetery\" id=\"mwAzA\">Notre Dame des Neiges Cemetery</a> is much larger, predominantly French-Canadian and officially Catholic.<sup about=\"#mwt715\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-115\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-115\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-115\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 115;\" id=\"mwAzE\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwAzI\">[115]</span></a></sup> More than 900,000 people are buried there.<sup about=\"#mwt719\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-116\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-116\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-116\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 116;\" id=\"mwAzM\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwAzQ\">[116]</span></a></sup></p>\n\n<p id=\"mwAzU\">Mount Royal Cemetery contains more than 162,000 graves and is the final resting place for a number of notable Canadians. It includes a veterans section with several soldiers who were awarded the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./British_Empire\" title=\"British Empire\" id=\"mwAzY\">British Empire</a>'s highest military honour, the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Victoria_Cross\" title=\"Victoria Cross\" id=\"mwAzc\">Victoria Cross</a>. In 1901, the Mount Royal Cemetery Company established the first crematorium in Canada.<sup about=\"#mwt724\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-MountRoyalCemetery_117-0\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{\"name\":\"MountRoyalCemetery\"},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-MountRoyalCemetery-117\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-MountRoyalCemetery-117\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 117;\" id=\"mwAzg\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwAzk\">[117]</span></a></sup></p>\n\n<p id=\"mwAzo\">The first <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Mount_Royal_Cross\" title=\"Mount Royal Cross\" id=\"mwAzs\">cross</a> on the mountain was placed there in 1643 by Paul Chomedey de Maisonneuve, the founder of the city, in fulfilment of a vow he made to the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Mary,_mother_of_Jesus\" title=\"Mary, mother of Jesus\" id=\"mwAzw\">Virgin Mary</a> when <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Prayer\" title=\"Prayer\" id=\"mwAz0\">praying</a> to her to stop a disastrous flood.<sup about=\"#mwt729\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-LesAmisDeLaMontagne_114-1\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{\"name\":\"LesAmisDeLaMontagne\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-LesAmisDeLaMontagne-114\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 114;\" id=\"mwAz4\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwAz8\">[114]</span></a></sup> Today, the mountain is crowned by a 31.4 m-high (103<span typeof=\"mw:Entity\" id=\"mwA0A\"> </span>ft) illuminated cross, installed in 1924 by the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Société_Saint-Jean-Baptiste\" title=\"Société Saint-Jean-Baptiste\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwA0E\">John the Baptist Society</a> and now owned by the city.<sup about=\"#mwt730\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-LesAmisDeLaMontagne_114-2\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{\"name\":\"LesAmisDeLaMontagne\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-LesAmisDeLaMontagne-114\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 114;\" about=\"#mwt841\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-2021CensusCity_132-3\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{\"name\":\"2021CensusCity\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-2021CensusCity-132\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 127;\" id=\"mwBFc\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBFg\">[127]</span></a></sup> 47.0% of Montreal residents spoke <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./French_language\" title=\"French language\" id=\"mwBFk\">French</a> alone as a first language, while 13.0% spoke <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./English_language\" title=\"English language\" id=\"mwBFo\">English</a> alone. 2% spoke both English and French as first languages, 2.6% spoke both French and a non-official language and 1.5% spoke both English and a non-official language. 0.8% of residents spoke English, French and a non-official language as first languages. 32.8% of residents had a non-official language as a mother tongue. The most common were <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Arabic\" title=\"Arabic\" id=\"mwBFs\">Arabic</a> (5.7%), <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Spanish_language\" title=\"Spanish language\" title=\"Chinese language\" id=\"mwBF4\">Chinese Languages</a> (2.7%), <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Haitian_Creole\" title=\"Haitian Creole\" id=\"mwBF8\">Haitian Creole</a> (1.6%), <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./China\" title=\"China\" id=\"mwBHA\">China</a> (26,335; 4.6%), the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Philippines\" title=\"Philippines\" id=\"mwBHE\">Philippines</a> id=\"mwBHM\">Vietnam</a> (16,395; 2.8%), and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./India\" title=\"India\" id=\"mwBHQ\">India</a> (13,575; 2.4%).<sup about=\"#mwt846\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" Church\" id=\"mwBHw\">Catholic</a>; however, weekly church attendance in Quebec was among the lowest in Canada in 1998.<sup about=\"#mwt855\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-139\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-139\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-139\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 134;\" id=\"mwBH0\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBH4\">[134]</span></a></sup> Historically Montreal has been a centre of Catholicism in North America with its numerous seminaries and churches, including the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Notre-Dame_Basilica_(Montreal)\" title=\"Notre-Dame Basilica (Montreal)\" id=\"mwBH8\">Notre-Dame Basilica</a>, the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Cathédrale_Marie-Reine-du-Monde\" title=\"Cathédrale Marie-Reine-du-Monde\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBIA\">Cathédrale Marie-Reine-du-Monde</a>, and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Saint_Joseph's_Oratory\" title=\"Saint Joseph's Oratory\" id=\"mwBIE\">Saint Joseph's Oratory</a>.</p>\n\n<p id=\"mwBII\">Some 49.5% of the total population is Christian,<sup about=\"#mwt860\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-Profil_Sociodémographique_Montréal_2011_138-1\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{\"name\":\"Profil Sociodémographique Montréal 2011\"},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-Profil_Sociodémographique_Montréal_2011-138\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-Profil_Sociodémographique_Montréal_2011-138\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 133;\" id=\"mwBIM\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBIQ\">[133]</span></a></sup> largely Roman Catholic (35.0%), primarily because of descendants of original French settlers, and others of Italian and Irish origins. <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Protestants\" title=\"Protestants\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBIU\">Protestants</a> which include <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Anglican_Church_in_Canada\" title=\"Anglican Church in Canada\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBIY\">Anglican Church in Canada</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./United_Church_of_Canada\" title=\"United Church of Canada\" id=\"mwBIc\">United Church of Canada</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Lutheran\" title=\"Lutheran\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBIg\">Lutheran</a>, owing to British and German immigration, and other denominations number 11.3%, with a further 3.2% consisting mostly of <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Eastern_Orthodox\" title=\"Eastern Orthodox\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBIk\">Orthodox Christians</a>, fuelled by a large Greek population. There is also a number of Russian and Ukrainian Orthodox parishes.</p>\n\n<p id=\"mwBIo\"><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Islam\" title=\"Islam\" id=\"mwBIs\">Islam</a> is the largest non-Christian religious group, with 218,395 members,<sup about=\"#mwt868\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-Community_Highlights_for_Montréal_140-0\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{\"name\":\"Community Highlights for Montréal\"},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-Community_Highlights_for_Montréal-140\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-Community_Highlights_for_Montréal-140\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 135;\" id=\"mwBIw\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBI0\">[135]</span></a></sup> the second-largest concentration of Muslims in Canada at 12.7%. The <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./History_of_the_Jews_in_Montreal\" title=\"History of the Jews in Montreal\" id=\"mwBI4\">Jewish community in Montreal</a> has a population of 90,780.<sup about=\"#mwt872\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-141\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-141\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-141\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 136;\" id=\"mwBI8\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBJA\">[136]</span></a></sup> In cities such as Côte Saint-Luc and Hampstead, Jewish people constitute the majority, or a substantial part of the population. In 1971 the Jewish community in Greater Montreal numbered 109,480.<sup about=\"#mwt876\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-MELS_142-0\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" In 2019, Metropolitan Montreal was responsible for <span style=\"white-space: nowrap\" about=\"#mwt887\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"CAD\",\"href\":\"./Template:CAD\"},\"params\":{\"1\":{\"wt\":\"234.0&amp;nbsp;billion\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwBJs\">CA$234.0<span typeof=\"mw:Entity\"> </span>billion</span> of Quebec's <span style=\"white-space: nowrap\" about=\"#mwt888\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"CAD\",\"href\":\"./Template:CAD\"},\"params\":{\"1\":{\"wt\":\"425.3&amp;nbsp;billion\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwBJw\">CA$425.3<span typeof=\"mw:Entity\"> </span>billion</span> GDP.<sup about=\"#mwt897\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-145\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-145\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-145\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 140;\" id=\"mwBJ0\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBJ4\">[140]</span></a></sup> The city is today an important centre of commerce, finance, industry, technology, culture, world affairs and is the headquarters of the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal_Exchange\" title=\"Montreal Exchange\" id=\"mwBJ8\">Montreal Exchange</a>. title=\"Inland port\" id=\"mwBKc\">inland ports</a> in the world, handling over 26 million <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Tonne\" title=\"Tonne\" id=\"mwBKg\">tonnes</a> of cargo annually.</figcaption></figure>\n<p id=\"mwBKk\">Industries include <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Aerospace\" title=\"Aerospace\" id=\"mwBKo\">aerospace</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" The service sector is also strong and includes <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Civil_engineering\" title=\"Civil engineering\" id=\"mwBK4\">civil</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Mechanical_engineering\" title=\"Mechanical engineering\" id=\"mwBK8\">mechanical</a> and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Process_engineering\" title=\"Process engineering\" id=\"mwBLA\">process engineering</a>, finance, higher education, and research and development. In 2002, Montreal was the fourth-largest centre in North America in terms of aerospace jobs.<sup about=\"#mwt906\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-147\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-147\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-147\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 142;\" id=\"mwBLE\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBLI\">[142]</span></a></sup>\nThe Port of Montreal is one of the largest inland ports in the world handling 26<span typeof=\"mw:Entity\" id=\"mwBLM\"> </span>million tonnes of cargo annually.<sup about=\"#mwt913\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-PortofMontreal_148-0\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{\"name\":\"PortofMontreal\"},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-PortofMontreal-148\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-PortofMontreal-148\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 143;\" id=\"mwBLQ\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBLU\">[143]</span></a></sup> As one of the most important ports in Canada, it remains a transshipment point for <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Cereal\" title=\"Cereal\" id=\"mwBLY\">grain</a>, sugar, petroleum products, machinery, and consumer goods. For this reason, Montreal is the railway hub of Canada and has always been an extremely important rail city; it is home to the headquarters of the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" Montreal's many cultural communities have given it a distinct local culture. Montreal was designated as the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./World_Book_Capital\" title=\"World Book Capital\" id=\"mwBZw\">World Book Capital</a> for the year 2005 by <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./UNESCO\" title=\"UNESCO\" id=\"mwBZ0\">UNESCO</a>.<sup about=\"#mwt1168\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-199\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-199\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-199\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 194;\" id=\"mwBZ4\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBZ8\">[194]</span></a></sup></p>\n<figure class=\"mw-default-size mw-halign-left\" typeof=\"mw:File/Thumb\" id=\"mwBaA\"><a href=\"./File:Montreal_Clock_Tower,_Fireworks.jpg\" class=\"mw-file-description\" id=\"mwBaE\"><img resource=\"./File:Montreal_Clock_Tower,_Fireworks.jpg\" src=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/29/Montreal_Clock_Tower%2C_Fireworks.jpg/220px-Montreal_Clock_Tower%2C_Fireworks.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" data-file-width=\"5621\" data-file-height=\"3897\" data-file-type=\"bitmap\" height=\"153\" width=\"220\" srcset=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/29/Montreal_Clock_Tower%2C_Fireworks.jpg/330px-Montreal_Clock_Tower%2C_Fireworks.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/29/Montreal_Clock_Tower%2C_Fireworks.jpg/440px-Montreal_Clock_Tower%2C_Fireworks.jpg 2x\" class=\"mw-file-element\" id=\"mwBaI\"/></a><figcaption id=\"mwBaM\"><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./L'International_des_Feux_Loto-Québec\" title=\"L'International des Feux Loto-Québec\" id=\"mwBaQ\">Montreal Fireworks Festival</a> is the world's largest annual fireworks festival. The city hosts a number of festivals annually.</figcaption></figure>\n<p id=\"mwBaU\">Being at the confluence of the French and the English traditions, Montreal has developed a unique and distinguished cultural face. The city has produced much talent in the fields of visual arts, theatre, dance, and music, with a tradition of producing both jazz and rock music. Another distinctive characteristic of cultural life is the vibrancy of its downtown, particularly during summer, prompted by cultural and social events, including its <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./List_of_festivals_and_parades_in_Montreal\" title=\"List of festivals and parades in Montreal\" id=\"mwBaY\">more than 100 annual festivals</a>, the largest being the Montreal International Jazz Festival which is the largest jazz festival in the world. Other popular events include the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Just_for_Laughs\" title=\"Just for Laughs\" id=\"mwBac\">Just for Laughs</a> (largest comedy festival in the world), Montreal World Film Festival, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Les_FrancoFolies_de_Montréal\" title=\"Les FrancoFolies de Montréal\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBag\">Les FrancoFolies de Montréal</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Nuits_d'Afrique?action=edit&amp;redlink=1\" title=\"Nuits d'Afrique\" about=\"#mwt1169\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion mw:LocalizedAttrs\" class=\"new\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"ill\",\"href\":\"./Template:Ill\"},\"params\":{\"1\":{\"wt\":\"Nuits d&apos;Afrique\"},\"2\":{\"wt\":\"fr\"},\"3\":{\"wt\":\"Festival international Nuits d&apos;Afrique\"},\"v\":{\"wt\":\"sup\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' data-mw-i18n='{\"title\":{\"lang\":\"x-page\",\"key\":\"red-link-title\",\"params\":[\"Nuits d&apos;Afrique\"]}}' id=\"mwBak\">Nuits d'Afrique</a><sup class=\"noprint\" style=\" font-style: normal; \" about=\"#mwt1169\" id=\"mwBao\"><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\"> </span><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">[</span><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink/Interwiki\" href=\"https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Festival%20international%20Nuits%20d'Afrique\" title=\"fr:Festival international Nuits d'Afrique\" class=\"extiw\">fr</a><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">]</span></sup>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Pop_Montreal\" title=\"Pop Montreal\" id=\"mwBas\">Pop Montreal</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Divers/Cité\" title=\"Divers/Cité\" id=\"mwBaw\">Divers/Cité</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Fierté_Montréal\" title=\"Fierté Montréal\" id=\"mwBa0\">Fierté Montréal</a> and the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal_Fireworks_Festival\" title=\"Montreal Fireworks Festival\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBa4\">Montreal Fireworks Festival</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Igloofest\" title=\"Igloofest\" id=\"mwBa8\">Igloofest</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Piknic_Électronik\" title=\"Piknic Électronik\" id=\"mwBbA\">Piknic Electronik</a>, Montréal en Lumiere, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Osheaga_Festival\" title=\"Osheaga Festival\" id=\"mwBbE\">Osheaga</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Heavy_Montréal\" title=\"Heavy Montréal\" id=\"mwBbI\">Heavy Montreal</a>, Mode + Design, Montréal complètement cirque, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./MUTEK\" title=\"MUTEK\" id=\"mwBbM\">MUTEK</a>, Black and Blue, and many smaller festivals. The city of Montreal is also widely recognized for its diverse and vibrant night life, which is considered a vital part of the local cultural ecosystem.</p>\n\n<p id=\"mwBbQ\">A cultural heart of classical art and the venue for many summer festivals, the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Place_des_Arts\" title=\"Place des Arts\" id=\"mwBbU\">Place des Arts</a> is a complex of different concert and theatre halls surrounding a large square in the eastern portion of downtown. <a rel=\"mw:ExtLink nofollow\" href=\"https://placedesarts.com/en\" class=\"external text\" id=\"mwBbY\">Place des Arts</a> has the headquarters of one of the world's foremost orchestras, the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal_Symphony_Orchestra\" title=\"Montreal Symphony Orchestra\" id=\"mwBbc\">Montreal Symphony Orchestra</a>. The <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Orchestre_Métropolitain_du_Grand_Montréal\" title=\"Orchestre Métropolitain du Grand Montréal\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBbg\">Orchestre Métropolitain du Grand Montréal</a> and the chamber orchestra <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./I_Musici_de_Montréal\" title=\"I Musici de Montréal\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBbk\">I Musici de Montréal</a> are two other well-regarded Montreal orchestras. Also performing at Place des Arts are the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Opéra_de_Montréal\" title=\"Opéra de Montréal\" id=\"mwBbo\">Opéra de Montréal</a> and the city's chief ballet company <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Les_Grands_Ballets_Canadiens\" title=\"Les Grands Ballets Canadiens\" id=\"mwBbs\">Les Grands Ballets Canadiens</a>. Internationally recognized avant-garde dance troupes such as <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Compagnie_Marie_Chouinard?action=edit&amp;redlink=1\" title=\"Compagnie Marie Chouinard\" about=\"#mwt1170\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion mw:LocalizedAttrs\" class=\"new\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"ill\",\"href\":\"./Template:Ill\"},\"params\":{\"1\":{\"wt\":\"Compagnie Marie Chouinard\"},\"2\":{\"wt\":\"fr\"},\"v\":{\"wt\":\"sup\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' data-mw-i18n='{\"title\":{\"lang\":\"x-page\",\"key\":\"red-link-title\",\"params\":[\"Compagnie Marie Chouinard\"]}}' id=\"mwBbw\">Compagnie Marie Chouinard</a><sup class=\"noprint\" style=\" font-style: normal; \" about=\"#mwt1170\" id=\"mwBb0\"><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\"> </span><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">[</span><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink/Interwiki\" href=\"https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compagnie%20Marie%20Chouinard\" title=\"fr:Compagnie Marie Chouinard\" class=\"extiw\">fr</a><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">]</span></sup>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./La_La_La_Human_Steps\" title=\"La La La Human Steps\" id=\"mwBb4\">La La La Human Steps</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./O_Vertigo?action=edit&amp;redlink=1\" title=\"O Vertigo\" about=\"#mwt1171\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion mw:LocalizedAttrs\" class=\"new\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"ill\",\"href\":\"./Template:Ill\"},\"params\":{\"1\":{\"wt\":\"O Vertigo\"},\"2\":{\"wt\":\"fr\"},\"v\":{\"wt\":\"sup\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' data-mw-i18n='{\"title\":{\"lang\":\"x-page\",\"key\":\"red-link-title\",\"params\":[\"O Vertigo\"]}}' id=\"mwBb8\">O Vertigo</a><sup class=\"noprint\" style=\" font-style: normal; \" about=\"#mwt1171\" id=\"mwBcA\"><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\"> </span><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">[</span><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink/Interwiki\" href=\"https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/O%20Vertigo\" title=\"fr:O Vertigo\" class=\"extiw\">fr</a><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">]</span></sup>, and the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Fondation_Jean-Pierre_Perreault?action=edit&amp;redlink=1\" title=\"Fondation Jean-Pierre Perreault\" about=\"#mwt1172\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion mw:LocalizedAttrs\" class=\"new\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"ill\",\"href\":\"./Template:Ill\"},\"params\":{\"1\":{\"wt\":\"Fondation Jean-Pierre Perreault\"},\"2\":{\"wt\":\"fr\"},\"3\":{\"wt\":\"Jean-Pierre Perreault#Biographie\"},\"v\":{\"wt\":\"sup\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' data-mw-i18n='{\"title\":{\"lang\":\"x-page\",\"key\":\"red-link-title\",\"params\":[\"Fondation Jean-Pierre Perreault\"]}}' id=\"mwBcE\">Fondation Jean-Pierre Perreault</a><sup class=\"noprint\" style=\" font-style: normal; \" about=\"#mwt1172\" id=\"mwBcI\"><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\"> </span><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">[</span><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink/Interwiki\" href=\"https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean-Pierre%20Perreault#Biographie\" title=\"fr:Jean-Pierre Perreault\" class=\"extiw\">fr</a><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">]</span></sup> have toured the world and worked with international popular artists on videos and concerts. The unique choreography of these troupes has paved the way for the success of the world-renowned Cirque du Soleil.</p>\n<figure class=\"mw-default-size\" typeof=\"mw:File/Thumb\" id=\"mwBcM\"><a href=\"./File:Basílica_de_Notre-Dame,_Montreal,_Canadá,_2017-08-11,_DD_26-28_HDR.jpg\" class=\"mw-file-description\" id=\"mwBcQ\"><img resource=\"./File:Basílica_de_Notre-Dame,_Montreal,_Canadá,_2017-08-11,_DD_26-28_HDR.jpg\" src=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7b/Bas%C3%ADlica_de_Notre-Dame%2C_Montreal%2C_Canad%C3%A1%2C_2017-08-11%2C_DD_26-28_HDR.jpg/220px-Bas%C3%ADlica_de_Notre-Dame%2C_Montreal%2C_Canad%C3%A1%2C_2017-08-11%2C_DD_26-28_HDR.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" data-file-width=\"6577\" data-file-height=\"4978\" data-file-type=\"bitmap\" height=\"167\" width=\"220\" srcset=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7b/Bas%C3%ADlica_de_Notre-Dame%2C_Montreal%2C_Canad%C3%A1%2C_2017-08-11%2C_DD_26-28_HDR.jpg/330px-Bas%C3%ADlica_de_Notre-Dame%2C_Montreal%2C_Canad%C3%A1%2C_2017-08-11%2C_DD_26-28_HDR.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7b/Bas%C3%ADlica_de_Notre-Dame%2C_Montreal%2C_Canad%C3%A1%2C_2017-08-11%2C_DD_26-28_HDR.jpg/440px-Bas%C3%ADlica_de_Notre-Dame%2C_Montreal%2C_Canad%C3%A1%2C_2017-08-11%2C_DD_26-28_HDR.jpg 2x\" class=\"mw-file-element\" id=\"mwBcU\"/></a><figcaption id=\"mwBcY\">View of the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Notre-Dame_Basilica_(Montreal)\" title=\"Notre-Dame Basilica (Montreal)\" id=\"mwBcc\">Notre-Dame Basilica</a> from <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Place_d'Armes\" title=\"Place d'Armes\" id=\"mwBcg\">Place d'Armes</a>. The number of churches in Montreal led it to be called \"the city of a hundred steeples\".</figcaption></figure>\n<p id=\"mwBck\">Nicknamed <i id=\"mwBco\"><span title=\"French-language text\" about=\"#mwt1176\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"lang\",\"href\":\"./Template:Lang\"},\"params\":{\"1\":{\"wt\":\"fr\"},\"2\":{\"wt\":\"la ville aux cent clochers\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwBcs\"><i lang=\"fr\">la ville aux cent clochers</i></span><link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:Articles_containing_French-language_text\" about=\"#mwt1176\" id=\"mwBcw\"/></i> (the city of a hundred steeples), Montreal is renowned for its churches. There are an estimated 650 churches on the island, with 450 of them dating back to the 1800s or earlier.<sup about=\"#mwt1180\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-200\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-200\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-200\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 195;\" id=\"mwBc0\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBc4\">[195]</span></a></sup> <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Mark_Twain\" title=\"Mark Twain\" id=\"mwBc8\">Mark Twain</a> noted, \"This is the first time I was ever in a city where you couldn't throw a brick without breaking a church window.\"<sup about=\"#mwt1184\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-201\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-201\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-201\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 196;\" id=\"mwBdA\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBdE\">[196]</span></a></sup> The city has four Roman Catholic <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Basilica\" title=\"Basilica\" id=\"mwBdI\">basilicas</a>: <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Mary,_Queen_of_the_World_Cathedral\" title=\"Mary, Queen of the World Cathedral\" id=\"mwBdM\">Mary, Queen of the World Cathedral</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Notre-Dame_Basilica_(Montreal)\" title=\"Notre-Dame Basilica (Montreal)\" id=\"mwBdQ\">Notre-Dame Basilica</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./St._Patrick's_Basilica,_Montreal\" title=\"St. Patrick's Basilica, Montreal\" id=\"mwBdU\">St Patrick's Basilica</a>, and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Saint_Joseph's_Oratory\" title=\"Saint Joseph's Oratory\" id=\"mwBdY\">Saint Joseph's Oratory</a>. The Oratory is the largest church in Canada, with the second largest copper dome in the world, after <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Saint_Peter's_Basilica\" title=\"Saint Peter's Basilica\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBdc\">Saint Peter's Basilica</a> in Rome.<sup about=\"#mwt1188\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-202\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-202\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-202\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 197;\" id=\"mwBdg\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBdk\">[197]</span></a></sup></p>\n\n<p id=\"mwBdo\">Beginning in the 1940s, Quebec literature began to shift from pastoral tales romanticising the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./French_Canadians\" title=\"French Canadians\" id=\"mwBds\">French-Canadian</a> countryside to writing set in the multicultural city of Montreal. Notable pioneering works describing the character of the city include <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Gabrielle_Roy\" title=\"Gabrielle Roy\" id=\"mwBdw\">Gabrielle Roy</a>'s 1945 novel <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./The_Tin_Flute\" title=\"The Tin Flute\" id=\"mwBd0\"><i id=\"mwBd4\">Bonheur D'Occasion</i></a>, translated as <i id=\"mwBd8\">The Tin Flute</i>, and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Gwethalyn_Graham\" title=\"Gwethalyn Graham\" id=\"mwBeA\">Gwethalyn Graham</a>'s 1944 novel <i id=\"mwBeE\">Earth and High Heaven</i>. Subsequent writers of fiction who have set their work in Montreal have included <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Mordecai_Richler\" title=\"Mordecai Richler\" id=\"mwBeI\">Mordecai Richler</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Claude_Jasmin\" title=\"Claude Jasmin\" id=\"mwBeM\">Claude Jasmin</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Francine_Noel\" title=\"Francine Noel\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBeQ\">Francine Noel</a>, and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Heather_O'Neill\" title=\"Heather O'Neill\" id=\"mwBeU\">Heather O'Neill</a>, among <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./List_of_people_from_Montreal\" title=\"List of people from Montreal\" id=\"mwBeY\">many others</a>.</p>\n\n</section><section data-mw-section-id=\"20\" id=\"mwBec\"><h2 id=\"Sports\">Sports</h2>\n<link rel=\"mw-deduplicated-inline-style\" href=\"mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096\" about=\"#mwt1189\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/templatestyles mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"Main\",\"href\":\"./Template:Main\"},\"params\":{\"1\":{\"wt\":\"Sports in Montreal\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwBeg\"/><div role=\"note\" class=\"hatnote navigation-not-searchable\" about=\"#mwt1189\" id=\"mwBek\">Main article: <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Sports_in_Montreal\" title=\"Sports in Montreal\">Sports in Montreal</a></div>\n<p id=\"mwBeo\">The most popular sport is <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Ice_hockey\" title=\"Ice hockey\" id=\"mwBes\">ice hockey</a>. The professional hockey team, the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal_Canadiens\" title=\"Montreal Canadiens\" id=\"mwBew\">Montreal Canadiens</a>, is one of the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Original_Six\" title=\"Original Six\" id=\"mwBe0\">Original Six</a> teams of the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./National_Hockey_League\" title=\"National Hockey League\" id=\"mwBe4\">National Hockey League</a> (NHL), and has won an NHL-record 24 <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Stanley_Cup\" title=\"Stanley Cup\" id=\"mwBe8\">Stanley Cup</a> championships. The Canadiens' most recent Stanley Cup victory came in <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./1993_Stanley_Cup_Finals\" title=\"1993 Stanley Cup Finals\" id=\"mwBfA\">1993</a>. They have major rivalries with the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Toronto_Maple_Leafs\" title=\"Toronto Maple Leafs\" id=\"mwBfE\">Toronto Maple Leafs</a> and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Boston_Bruins\" title=\"Boston Bruins\" id=\"mwBfI\">Boston Bruins</a>, both of which are also Original Six teams, and with the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Ottawa_Senators\" title=\"Ottawa Senators\" id=\"mwBfM\">Ottawa Senators</a>, the closest team geographically. The Canadiens have played at the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Bell_Centre\" title=\"Bell Centre\" id=\"mwBfQ\">Bell Centre</a> since 1996. Prior to that they played at the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal_Forum\" title=\"Montreal Forum\" id=\"mwBfU\">Montreal Forum</a>.</p>\n<figure class=\"mw-default-size mw-halign-left\" typeof=\"mw:File/Thumb\" id=\"mwBfY\"><a href=\"./File:CentreBell.jpg\" class=\"mw-file-description\" id=\"mwBfc\"><img resource=\"./File:CentreBell.jpg\" src=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/80/CentreBell.jpg/220px-CentreBell.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" data-file-width=\"750\" data-file-height=\"500\" data-file-type=\"bitmap\" height=\"147\" width=\"220\" srcset=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/80/CentreBell.jpg/330px-CentreBell.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/80/CentreBell.jpg/440px-CentreBell.jpg 2x\" class=\"mw-file-element\" id=\"mwBfg\"/></a><figcaption id=\"mwBfk\">Opened in 1996, the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Bell_Centre\" title=\"Bell Centre\" id=\"mwBfo\">Bell Centre</a> is a sports and entertainment complex and the home arena for the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal_Canadiens\" title=\"Montreal Canadiens\" id=\"mwBfs\">Montreal Canadiens</a>.</figcaption></figure>\n<p id=\"mwBfw\">The <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal_Alouettes\" title=\"Montreal Alouettes\" id=\"mwBf0\">Montreal Alouettes</a> of the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Canadian_Football_League\" title=\"Canadian Football League\" id=\"mwBf4\">Canadian Football League</a> (CFL) play at <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Percival_Molson_Memorial_Stadium\" title=\"Percival Molson Memorial Stadium\" id=\"mwBf8\">Percival Molson Memorial Stadium</a> on the campus of <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./McGill_University\" title=\"McGill University\" id=\"mwBgA\">McGill University</a> for their regular-season games. Late season and playoff games are sometimes played at the much larger, enclosed Olympic Stadium, which also hosted the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./2008_Grey_Cup\" title=\"2008 Grey Cup\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBgE\">2008 Grey Cup</a>. The Alouettes have won the Grey Cup eight times, most recently in <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./111th_Grey_Cup\" title=\"111th Grey Cup\" id=\"mwBgI\">2023</a>. The Alouettes have had two periods on hiatus. During the second one, the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal_Machine\" title=\"Montreal Machine\" id=\"mwBgM\">Montreal Machine</a> played in the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./World_League_of_American_Football\" title=\"World League of American Football\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBgQ\">World League of American Football</a> in 1991 and 1992. The <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./McGill_Redbirds_and_Martlets\" title=\"McGill Redbirds and Martlets\" id=\"mwBgU\">McGill Redbirds</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Concordia_Stingers\" title=\"Concordia Stingers\" id=\"mwBgY\">Concordia Stingers</a>, and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Université_de_Montréal_Carabins\" title=\"Université de Montréal Carabins\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBgc\">Université de Montréal Carabins</a> play in the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./U_Sports_football\" title=\"U Sports football\" id=\"mwBgg\">U Sports football</a> league.</p>\n\n<p id=\"mwBgk\">Montreal has a storied baseball history. The city was the home of the minor-league <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal_Royals\" title=\"Montreal Royals\" id=\"mwBgo\">Montreal Royals</a> of the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./International_League\" title=\"International League\" id=\"mwBgs\">International League</a> until 1960. In 1946, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Jackie_Robinson\" title=\"Jackie Robinson\" id=\"mwBgw\">Jackie Robinson</a> broke the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Baseball_colour_line\" title=\"Baseball colour line\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBg0\">Baseball colour line</a> with the Royals in an emotionally difficult year; Robinson was forever grateful for the local fans' fervent support.<sup about=\"#mwt1197\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-203\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-203\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-203\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 198;\" id=\"mwBg4\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBg8\">[198]</span></a></sup> <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Major_League_Baseball\" title=\"Major League Baseball\" id=\"mwBhA\">Major League Baseball</a> came to town in the form of the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal_Expos\" title=\"Montreal Expos\" id=\"mwBhE\">Montreal Expos</a> in 1969. They played their games at <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Jarry_Park_Stadium\" title=\"Jarry Park Stadium\" id=\"mwBhI\">Jarry Park Stadium</a> until moving into Olympic Stadium in 1977. After 36 years in Montreal, the team relocated to Washington, D.C., in 2005 and re-branded themselves as the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Washington_Nationals\" title=\"Washington Nationals\" id=\"mwBhM\">Washington Nationals</a>.<sup about=\"#mwt1201\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-204\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-204\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-204\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 199;\" id=\"mwBhQ\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBhU\">[199]</span></a></sup></p>\n\n<figure class=\"mw-default-size\" typeof=\"mw:File/Thumb\" id=\"mwBhY\"><a href=\"./File:2015_Canadian_GP_opening_lap.jpg\" class=\"mw-file-description\" id=\"mwBhc\"><img resource=\"./File:2015_Canadian_GP_opening_lap.jpg\" src=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/2015_Canadian_GP_opening_lap.jpg/220px-2015_Canadian_GP_opening_lap.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" data-file-width=\"3820\" data-file-height=\"1685\" data-file-type=\"bitmap\" height=\"97\" width=\"220\" srcset=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/2015_Canadian_GP_opening_lap.jpg/330px-2015_Canadian_GP_opening_lap.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/2015_Canadian_GP_opening_lap.jpg/440px-2015_Canadian_GP_opening_lap.jpg 2x\" class=\"mw-file-element\" id=\"mwBhg\"/></a><figcaption id=\"mwBhk\">Montreal is the site of the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Canadian_Grand_Prix\" title=\"Canadian Grand Prix\" id=\"mwBho\">Canadian Grand Prix</a>, an annual <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Formula_One\" title=\"Formula One\" id=\"mwBhs\">Formula One</a> <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Auto_race\" title=\"Auto race\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBhw\">auto race</a>.</figcaption></figure>\n\n<p id=\"mwBh0\"><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./CF_Montréal\" title=\"CF Montréal\" id=\"mwBh4\">CF Montréal</a> (formerly known as the Montreal Impact) are the city's professional soccer team. They play at a <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Soccer-specific_stadium\" title=\"Soccer-specific stadium\" id=\"mwBh8\">soccer-specific stadium</a> called <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Saputo_Stadium\" title=\"Saputo Stadium\" id=\"mwBiA\">Saputo Stadium</a>. They joined North America's biggest soccer league, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Major_League_Soccer\" title=\"Major League Soccer\" id=\"mwBiE\">Major League Soccer</a>, in 2012. The Montreal games of the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./2007_FIFA_U-20_World_Cup\" title=\"2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup\" id=\"mwBiI\">2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup</a><sup about=\"#mwt1208\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-205\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-205\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-205\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 200;\" id=\"mwBiM\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBiQ\">[200]</span></a></sup> and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./2014_FIFA_U-20_Women's_World_Cup\" title=\"2014 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup\" id=\"mwBiU\">2014 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup</a><sup about=\"#mwt1212\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-206\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-206\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-206\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 201;\" id=\"mwBiY\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBic\">[201]</span></a></sup> were held at Olympic Stadium, and the venue hosted Montreal games in the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./2015_FIFA_Women's_World_Cup\" title=\"2015 FIFA Women's World Cup\" id=\"mwBig\">2015 FIFA Women's World Cup</a>.<sup about=\"#mwt1216\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-207\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-207\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-207\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 202;\" id=\"mwBik\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBio\">[202]</span></a></sup></p>\n\n<p id=\"mwBis\">Montreal is the site of a high-profile <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Auto_racing\" title=\"Auto racing\" id=\"mwBiw\">auto racing</a> event each year: the Canadian Grand Prix of Formula One (F1) racing. This race takes place on the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Circuit_Gilles_Villeneuve\" title=\"Circuit Gilles Villeneuve\" id=\"mwBi0\">Circuit Gilles Villeneuve</a> on Île Notre-Dame. In 2009, the race was dropped from the Formula One calendar, to the chagrin of some fans,<sup about=\"#mwt1221\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-208\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-208\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-208\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 203;\" id=\"mwBi4\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBi8\">[203]</span></a></sup> but the Canadian Grand Prix returned to the Formula One calendar in 2010. It was dropped from the calendar again in 2020 and 2021, due to <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./COVID-19_pandemic\" title=\"COVID-19 pandemic\" id=\"mwBjA\">COVID-19 pandemic</a>, but racing resumed in 2022, with the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./2022_Canadian_Grand_Prix\" title=\"2022 Canadian Grand Prix\" id=\"mwBjE\">2022 Canadian Grand Prix</a>. The Circuit Gilles Villeneuve also hosted a round of the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Champ_Car_World_Series\" title=\"Champ Car World Series\" id=\"mwBjI\">Champ Car World Series</a> from 2002 to 2007, and was home to the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./NAPA_Auto_Parts_200\" title=\"NAPA Auto Parts 200\" id=\"mwBjM\">NAPA Auto Parts 200</a>, a <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./NASCAR_Nationwide_Series\" title=\"NASCAR Nationwide Series\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBjQ\">NASCAR Nationwide Series</a> race, and the Montréal 200, a <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Grand_American_Road_Racing_Association\" title=\"Grand American Road Racing Association\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBjU\">Grand Am</a> <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Rolex_Sports_Car_Series\" title=\"Rolex Sports Car Series\" id=\"mwBjY\">Rolex Sports Car Series</a> race.</p>\n\n<p id=\"mwBjc\"><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Uniprix_Stadium\" title=\"Uniprix Stadium\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBjg\">Uniprix Stadium</a>, built in 1993 on the site of Jarry Park, is used for the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Canadian_Open_(tennis)\" title=\"Canadian Open (tennis)\" id=\"mwBjk\">National Bank Open</a> (formerly known as the Rogers Cup) men's and women's tennis tournaments. The men's tournament is a <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Masters_1000\" title=\"Masters 1000\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBjo\">Masters 1000</a> event on the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./ATP_Tour\" title=\"ATP Tour\" id=\"mwBjs\">ATP Tour</a>, and the women's tournament is a <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./WTA_Premier_tournaments\" title=\"WTA Premier tournaments\" id=\"mwBjw\">Premier tournament</a> on the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./WTA_Tour\" title=\"WTA Tour\" id=\"mwBj0\">WTA Tour</a>. The men's and women's tournaments alternate between Montreal and Toronto every year.<sup about=\"#mwt1226\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-YorkU_209-0\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{\"name\":\"YorkU\"},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-YorkU-209\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-YorkU-209\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 204;\" id=\"mwBj4\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBj8\">[204]</span></a></sup></p>\n<figure class=\"mw-default-size\" typeof=\"mw:File/Thumb\" id=\"mwBkA\"><a href=\"./File:Le_Stade_Olympique_3.jpg\" class=\"mw-file-description\" id=\"mwBkE\"><img resource=\"./File:Le_Stade_Olympique_3.jpg\" src=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Le_Stade_Olympique_3.jpg/220px-Le_Stade_Olympique_3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" data-file-width=\"800\" data-file-height=\"600\" data-file-type=\"bitmap\" height=\"165\" width=\"220\" srcset=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Le_Stade_Olympique_3.jpg/330px-Le_Stade_Olympique_3.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Le_Stade_Olympique_3.jpg/440px-Le_Stade_Olympique_3.jpg 2x\" class=\"mw-file-element\" id=\"mwBkI\"/></a><figcaption id=\"mwBkM\">The <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Olympic_Stadium_(Montreal)\" title=\"Olympic Stadium (Montreal)\" id=\"mwBkQ\">Olympic Stadium</a> was built for the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./1976_Summer_Olympics\" title=\"1976 Summer Olympics\" id=\"mwBkU\">1976 Summer Olympics</a> in Montreal. It is used by <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Major_League_Soccer\" title=\"Major League Soccer\" id=\"mwBkY\">MLS</a>'s <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./CF_Montréal\" title=\"CF Montréal\" id=\"mwBkc\">CF Montréal</a> for select games.</figcaption></figure>\n<p id=\"mwBkg\">Montreal was the host of the 1976 Summer Olympic Games. The stadium cost $1.5<span typeof=\"mw:Entity\" id=\"mwBkk\"> </span>billion;<sup about=\"#mwt1232\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-olympics_cost_210-0\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{\"name\":\"olympics cost\"},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-olympics_cost-210\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-olympics_cost-210\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 205;\" id=\"mwBko\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBks\">[205]</span></a></sup> with interest that figure ballooned to nearly $3<span typeof=\"mw:Entity\" id=\"mwBkw\"> </span>billion, and was paid off in December 2006.<sup about=\"#mwt1236\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{\"name\":\"McGill-olympics-cost\"},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-McGill-olympics-cost-211\"}}'><a activities.</p>\n\n<p id=\"mwBlA\">Montreal was the host city for the 17th unicycling world championship and convention (<a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./UNICON\" title=\"UNICON\" class=\"mw-redirect\" rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Terrestrial_television\" title=\"Terrestrial television\" id=\"mwBpo\">over-the-air</a> English-language television stations: <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./CBMT-DT\" title=\"CBMT-DT\" id=\"mwBps\">CBMT-DT</a> (<a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./CBC_Television\" title=\"CBC Television\" id=\"mwBpw\">CBC Television</a>), <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./CFCF-DT\" title=\"CFCF-DT\" id=\"mwBp0\">CFCF-DT</a> (<a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./CTV_Television_Network\" title=\"CTV Television Network\" id=\"mwBp4\">CTV</a>), <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./CKMI-DT\" title=\"CKMI-DT\" id=\"mwBp8\">CKMI-DT</a> (<a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Global_Television_Network\" title=\"Global Television Network\" id=\"mwBqA\">Global</a>) and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" There are also five over-the-air French-language television stations: <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./CBFT-DT\" title=\"CBFT-DT\" id=\"mwBqM\">CBFT-DT</a> (<a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Ici_Radio-Canada_Télé\" title=\"Ici Radio-Canada Télé\" id=\"mwBqQ\">Ici Radio-Canada</a>), <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./CFTM-DT\" title=\"CFTM-DT\" id=\"mwBqU\">CFTM-DT</a> (<a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./CFTU-DT\" title=\"CFTU-DT\" id=\"mwBqo\">CFTU-DT</a> (Canal Savoir).</p>\n\n<p id=\"mwBqs\">Montreal has three daily newspapers, the English-language <i id=\"mwBqw\"><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./City_government_in_Montreal\" title=\"City government in Montreal\" class=\"mw-redirect\" id=\"mwBr4\">city government in Montreal</a> is the mayor, who is <a id=\"mwBsM\">Completed in 1878, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal_City_Hall\" title=\"Montreal City Hall\" id=\"mwBsQ\">Montreal City Hall</a> is the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Montreal_City_Council\" title=\"Montreal City Council\" id=\"mwBsU\">seat of local government</a>.</figcaption></figure>\n<p id=\"mwBsY\">The city council is a democratically elected institution and is the final decision-making authority in the city, although much power is centralized in the executive committee. The council consists of 65 members from all boroughs.<sup about=\"#mwt1255\" class=\"mw-ref reference\" id=\"cite_ref-councillors_212-0\" rel=\"dc:references\" typeof=\"mw:Extension/ref\" data-mw='{\"name\":\"ref\",\"attrs\":{\"name\":\"councillors\"},\"body\":{\"id\":\"mw-reference-text-cite_note-councillors-212\"}}'><a href=\"./Montreal#cite_note-councillors-212\" style=\"counter-reset: mw-Ref 207;\" id=\"mwBsc\"><span class=\"mw-reflink-text\" id=\"mwBsg\">[207]</span></a></sup> The council has jurisdiction over many matters, including public security, agreements with other governments, subsidy programs, the <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Natural_environment\" title=\"Natural environment\" id=\"mwBsk\">environment</a>, <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Urban_planning\" title=\"Urban planning\" id=\"mwBso\">urban planning</a>, and a three-year capital expenditure program. The council is required to supervise, standardize or approve certain decisions made by the borough councils.<link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:All_articles_with_unsourced_statements\" about=\"#mwt1251\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"citation needed\",\"href\":\"./Template:Citation_needed\"},\"params\":{\"date\":{\"wt\":\"May 2022\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwBss\"/><link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:Articles_with_unsourced_statements_from_May_2022\" about=\"#mwt1251\"/><sup class=\"noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact\" style=\"white-space:nowrap;\" about=\"#mwt1251\" id=\"mwBsw\"><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">[</span><i><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Wikipedia:Citation_needed\" title=\"Wikipedia:Citation needed\"><span title=\"This claim needs references to reliable sources. (May 2022)\">citation needed</span></a></i><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">]</span></sup></p>\n\n<p id=\"mwBs0\">Reporting directly to the council, the executive committee exercises decision-making powers similar to those of the cabinet in a <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Parliamentary_system\" title=\"Parliamentary system\" id=\"mwBs4\">parliamentary system</a> and is responsible for preparing various documents including <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Budget\" title=\"Budget\" id=\"mwBs8\">budgets</a> and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./By-law\" title=\"By-law\" id=\"mwBtA\">by-laws</a>, submitted to the council for approval. The decision-making powers of the executive committee cover, in particular, the awarding of contracts or grants, the management of human and financial resources, supplies and buildings. It may also be assigned further powers by the city council.<link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:All_articles_with_unsourced_statements\" about=\"#mwt1256\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"citation needed\",\"href\":\"./Template:Citation_needed\"},\"params\":{\"date\":{\"wt\":\"May 2022\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwBtE\"/><link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:Articles_with_unsourced_statements_from_May_2022\" about=\"#mwt1256\"/><sup class=\"noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact\" style=\"white-space:nowrap;\" about=\"#mwt1256\" id=\"mwBtI\"><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">[</span><i><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Wikipedia:Citation_needed\" title=\"Wikipedia:Citation needed\"><span title=\"This claim needs references to reliable sources. (May 2022)\">citation needed</span></a></i><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">]</span></sup></p>\n\n<p id=\"mwBtM\">Standing committees are the prime instruments for public consultation. They are responsible for the public study of pending matters and for making the appropriate recommendations to the council. They also review the annual budget forecasts for departments under their jurisdiction. A public notice of meeting is published in both French and English daily newspapers at least seven days before each meeting. All meetings include a public question period. The standing committees, of which there are seven, have terms lasting two years. In addition, the City Council may decide to create special committees at any time. Each standing committee is made up of seven to nine members, including a chairman and a vice-chairman. The members are all elected municipal officers, with the exception of a representative of the government of Quebec on the public security committee.<link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:All_articles_with_unsourced_statements\" about=\"#mwt1257\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\" data-mw='{\"parts\":[{\"template\":{\"target\":{\"wt\":\"citation needed\",\"href\":\"./Template:Citation_needed\"},\"params\":{\"date\":{\"wt\":\"May 2022\"}},\"i\":0}}]}' id=\"mwBtQ\"/><link rel=\"mw:PageProp/Category\" href=\"./Category:Articles_with_unsourced_statements_from_May_2022\" about=\"#mwt1257\"/><sup class=\"noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact\" style=\"white-space:nowrap;\" about=\"#mwt1257\" id=\"mwBtU\"><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">[</span><i><a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Wikipedia:Citation_needed\" title=\"Wikipedia:Citation needed\"><span title=\"This claim needs references to reliable sources. (May 2022)\">citation needed</span></a></i><span typeof=\"mw:Entity\">]</span></sup></p>\n\n<p id=\"mwBtY\">The city is only one component of the larger Montreal Metropolitan Community (Communauté Métropolitaine de Montréal, CMM), which is in charge of planning, coordinating, and financing economic development, public transportation, garbage collection and <a rel=\"mw:WikiLink\" href=\"./Waste_management\" title=\"Waste management\" id=\"mwBtc\">waste management</a>, etc., across the metropolitan area. The president of the CMM is the mayor of Montreal. The CMM covers <span about=\"#mwt1259\" typeof=\"mw:Transclusion\"
